00421     // handle the error
00422   }
00423  
00424   // Check the TDC status for error codes (typically "DLL unlocked" problems)
00425   // and add an error flag word if a problem is found.
00426   short str2 = vme_read_d16(caen->vme_handle, caen->vme_base | CAENV767_STR2);
00427   if(str2 & CAENV767_GLOBAL_TDC_ERROR) {
00428     DWORD flag_word = CAENV767_NOT_VALID;
00429     for(int tdc = 0; tdc < 4; tdc++) {
00430       short ind_tdc_error_mask = (1 << (12+tdc));
00431       if(str2 & (1 << (12+tdc))) {
00432         flag_word |= (1 << tdc); 
00433       }
00434     }
00435 
00436     pdata[(active_size + final_size)/sizeof(DWORD)] = flag_word;
00437     final_size += sizeof(DWORD);
00438 
00439     diag_print(0, "TDC error in %s: 0x%08x\n", caen->odb_name, flag_word);
00440   }
00441 
00442   // Close the bank
00443   bk_close(pevent, pdata + (active_size + final_size)/sizeof(DWORD));
00444 
00445   // Clear for the next block
00446   caen->active_readout_size = 0;
00447 
00448   // Reset the TDC
00449   vme_write_d16(caen->vme_handle, caen->vme_base | CAENV767_CLEAR, 1);
00450 
00451   // Update the expected rate.
00452   if(block_start_time.tv_sec != 0) {  
00453     struct timeval now;

00455     double block_seconds = (now.tv_sec - block_start_time.tv_sec) + 
00456                              1e-6*(now.tv_usec - block_start_time.tv_usec);
00457     caen->bytes_per_second = (active_size + final_size)/block_seconds;
00458   }
00459   block_start_time.tv_sec = block_start_time.tv_usec = 0;
